newsitem.title: POLAND: DAEWOO TO UP STAKE IN POLISH PLANT, INVEST $100 MLN.
newsitem.headline: DAEWOO TO UP STAKE IN POLISH PLANT, INVEST $100 MLN.

text.p: South Korea's Daewoo Heavy Industries wants to raise its stake in the Polish engine-maker Andoria SA to over 75 percent from 13 percent and then invest $100 million in the company, Andoria's president said.

Antoni Wojniak told Reuters Daewoo wanted to invest in the production of diesel engines for its new delivery van in Andoria, but that the timetable of the investment would be decided within the next six months.
"Over the next six months Andoria and Daewoo will draw up a joint business plan and investment plan for the factory in which would detail the investment schedule," Wojniak said.
"Daewoo has pledged to invest $100 million after aquiring a stake of over 75 percent in Andoria," he said.
Local Daewoo officials were not immediately available for comment.
Daewoo bought its current 13 percent in Andoria from National Investment Fund (NFI) No.13 which had held a 33 percent stake in the company.
Of the remaining 27 percent is in the hands of 14 other NFIs, the treasury has 25 percent and employees 15 percent.

Andoria based in Andrychow, southern Poland, which employs 3,100 people, had a net profit of 900,000 zlotys on sales of 125.3 million zlotys. Wojniak said he expected sales to rise 60 percent next year with the net profit flat because of the company's heavy investment programme.
